sentence.Network_en: Carrie felt this to contain, in some way , an aspersion upon her ability.
sentence.Network_cn: 嘉莉觉得这话多少含有贬低她的才能的意思.

sentence.Network_en: Should you hear my name blackened and maligned, will you credit the aspersion?
sentence.Network_cn: 要是你听见我的名誉受到诽谤, 你会相信那谗言 吗 ?

sentence.Network_en: Suddenly, who is knowing in aspersion, be spilled on my foot completely.
sentence.Network_cn: 忽然, 不知是谁在洒水, 全泼在我脚上了.

list.abs: thank those who asperse you since it encouraged your personality .感激中伤你的人，因为他砥砺了你的人格；

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (denoting the sprinkling of water, especially at baptism): from Latin aspersio(n-), from aspergere (see asperse)

sentences.sentence: "in the 19th century any reference to female sexuality was considered a vile aspersion"
"it is difficult for a woman to understand a man's sensitivity to any slur on his virility"

means.word_mean: 2. an abusive attack on a person's character or good name
3. the act of sprinkling water in baptism (rare)

auth_sentence.content: By the aspersion of the bloud of Jesus Christ.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: By the aspersion of the bloud of Jesus Christ.

sentences.en: I don’t permit to cast aspersions on my friend.
sentences.cn: 我不许你诽谤我的朋友。

sentences.en: Why did he cast aspersions upon us?
